elements.description:
The `<outh2-authorization>` performs an OAuth2 requests to get a token for given settings.

There are 4 basic token requests flows:
- Authorization Code for apps running on a web server (`authorization_code` type)
- Implicit for browser-based or mobile apps (`implicit` type)
- Password for logging in with a username and password (`password` type)
- Client credentials for application access (`client_credentials` type)

This element uses them all.

Main function is the `authorize()` function that can be also used via event system.
This function accepts different set of parameters depending on request type. However it will
not perform a validation on the settings. It will try to perform the request for given set of
parameters. If it fails, than it fail on the server side.

### Example

```
<outh2-authorization></outh2-authorization>
```
```
const settings = {
  type: 'implicit',
  clientId: 'CLIENT ID',
  redirectUri: 'https://example.com/auth-popup.html',
  authorizationUri: 'https://auth.example.com/token'
  scopes: ['email'],
  state: 'Optional string'
};
const factory = document.querySelector('outh2-authorization');
factory.authorize(settings)

// or event based
const event = new CustomEvent('oauth2-token-requested', { 'detail': settings, bubbles: true });
document.dispatchEvent(event);
```

There is one difference for from using event based approach. When the token has been received
this will set `tokenValue` property on the target of the event.
The event will be canceled one it reach this element so other elements will not double the action.

An element or app that requesting the token should observe the `oauth2-token-response` and
`oauth2-error` events to get back the response.

## Popup in authorization flow

This element conatin a `oauth-popup.html` that can be used to exchange token / code data with
hosting page. Other page can be used as well. But in must `window.postMessage` back to the
`window.opener`. The structure of the message if the parsed query or has string to the map
of parameters. Furthermore it must camel case the parameters. Example script is source code
of the `oauth-popup.html` page.
Popup should be served over the SSL.

## The state parameter and security

This element is intened to be used in debug applications where confidentialy is already
compromised because users may be asked to provide client secret parameter (depending on the flow).
*It should not be used in client applications** that don't serve debugging purposes.
Client secret should never be used on the client side.

To have at least minimum of protection (in already compromised environment) this library generates
a `state` parameter as a series of alphanumeric characters and append them to the request.
It is expected to return the same string in the response (as defined in rfc6749). Though this
parameter is optional, it will reject the response if the `state` parameter is not the same as the
one generated before the request.

The state parameter is generated automatically by the element if non provided in
settings. It is a good idea to use this property to check if the event response
(either token or error) are comming from your request for token. The app can
support different oauth clients so you can check later with the token response if
this is a response for the same client.

## Non-interactive authorization (experimental)

For `implicit` and `code` token requests you can set `interactive` property
of the settings object to `false` to request the token in the background without
displaying any UI related to authorization to the user.
It can be used to request an access token after the user authorized the application.
Server should return the token which will be passed back to the application.

When using `interactive = false` mode then the response event is always
`oauth2-token-response`, even when there was authorization error or user never
authorized the application. In this case the response object will not carry
`accessToken` property and always have `interactive` set to `false` and `code`
to determine cause of unsuccesful request.

### Example

```
const settings = {
  interactive: false,
  type: 'implicit',
  clientId: 'CLIENT ID',
  redirectUri: 'https://example.com/auth-popup.html',
  authorizationUri: 'https://auth.example.com/token'
  state: '1234'
};
const event = new CustomEvent('oauth2-token-requested', { 'detail': settings, bubbles: true });
document.dispatchEvent(event);

document.body.addEventListener('oauth2-token-response', (e) => {
  let info = e.detail;
  if (info.state !== '1234') {
    return;
  }
  if (info.interactive === false && info.code) {
    // unsuccesful request
    return;
  }
  let token = info.accessToken;
});
```

## Demo
See `auth-methods` > `auth-method-oauth2` element for the demo.

## Changes in version 2

- event source is no longer processed. The component will not set `tokenValue`
on the event source.
- client credentials, password and custom grant types returns `Promise` with
token info. It also dispatches response or error events.
- replaced `redirectUrl` property with `redirectUri`
- replaced `authorizationUrl` property with `authorizationUri`
- replaced `accessTokenUrl` property with `accessTokenUri`

properties.name: tokenInfo
properties.description: A full data returned by the authorization endpoint.

methods.name: _stampTemplate
methods.description:
Stamps the provided template and performs instance-time setup for
Polymer template features, including data bindings, declarative event
listeners, and the `this.$` map of `id`'s to nodes.  A document fragment
is returned containing the stamped DOM, ready for insertion into the
DOM.

This method may be called more than once; however note that due to
`shadycss` polyfill limitations, only styles from templates prepared
using `ShadyCSS.prepareTemplate` will be correctly polyfilled (scoped
to the shadow root and support CSS custom properties), and note that
`ShadyCSS.prepareTemplate` may only be called once per element. As such,
any styles required by in runtime-stamped templates must be included
in the main element template.

return.desc: Cloned template content

methods.name: _addMethodEventListenerToNode
methods.description:
Adds an event listener by method name for the event provided.

This method generates a handler function that looks up the method
name at handling time.

params.name: context
params.description:
Context the method will be called on (defaults
  to `node`)

return.desc: Generated handler function

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Override point for adding custom or simulated event handling.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Override point for adding custom or simulated event handling.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: _createPropertyAccessor
methods.description:
Creates a setter/getter pair for the named property with its own
local storage.  The getter returns the value in the local storage,
and the setter calls `_setProperty`, which updates the local storage
for the property and enqueues a `_propertiesChanged` callback.

This method may be called on a prototype or an instance.  Calling
this method may overwrite a property value that already exists on
the prototype/instance by creating the accessor.

params.name: readOnly
params.description:
When true, no setter is created; the
  protected `_setProperty` function must be used to set the property

methods.name: _addPropertyToAttributeMap
methods.description:
Adds the given `property` to a map matching attribute names
to property names, using `attributeNameForProperty`. This map is
used when deserializing attribute values to properties.

methods.name: _definePropertyAccessor
methods.description: Defines a property accessor for the given property.

params.name: readOnly
params.description: When true, no setter is created

methods.name: ready
methods.description: Stamps the element template.

methods.name: _initializeProperties
methods.description:
Overrides the default `Polymer.PropertyAccessors` to ensure class
metaprogramming related to property accessors and effects has
completed (calls `finalize`).

It also initializes any property defaults provided via `value` in
`properties` metadata.

methods.name: _initializeInstanceProperties
methods.description:
Called at ready time with bag of instance properties that overwrote
accessors when the element upgraded.

The default implementation sets these properties back into the
setter at ready time.  This method is provided as an override
point for customizing or providing more efficient initialization.

params.name: props
params.description:
Bag of property values that were overwritten
  when creating property accessors.

methods.name: _setProperty
methods.description:
Updates the local storage for a property (via `_setPendingProperty`)
and enqueues a `_proeprtiesChanged` callback.

methods.name: _getProperty
methods.description: Returns the value for the given property.

return.desc: Value for the given property

methods.name: _setPendingProperty
methods.description:
Updates the local storage for a property, records the previous value,
and adds it to the set of "pending changes" that will be passed to the
`_propertiesChanged` callback.  This method does not enqueue the
`_propertiesChanged` callback.

params.name: ext
params.description: Not used here; affordance for closure

return.desc: Returns true if the property changed

methods.name: _invalidateProperties
methods.description:
Marks the properties as invalid, and enqueues an async
`_propertiesChanged` callback.

methods.name: _enableProperties
methods.description:
Call to enable property accessor processing. Before this method is
called accessor values will be set but side effects are
queued. When called, any pending side effects occur immediately.
For elements, generally `connectedCallback` is a normal spot to do so.
It is safe to call this method multiple times as it only turns on
property accessors once.

methods.name: _flushProperties
methods.description:
Calls the `_propertiesChanged` callback with the current set of
pending changes (and old values recorded when pending changes were
set), and resets the pending set of changes. Generally, this method
should not be called in user code.

methods.name: _propertiesChanged
methods.description:
Callback called when any properties with accessors created via
`_createPropertyAccessor` have been set.

params.name: currentProps
params.description: Bag of all current accessor values

params.name: changedProps
params.description:
Bag of properties changed since the last
  call to `_propertiesChanged`

params.name: oldProps
params.description:
Bag of previous values for each property
  in `changedProps`

methods.name: _shouldPropertyChange
methods.description:
Method called to determine whether a property value should be
considered as a change and cause the `_propertiesChanged` callback
to be enqueued.

The default implementation returns `true` if a strict equality
check fails. The method always returns false for `NaN`.

Override this method to e.g. provide stricter checking for
Objects/Arrays when using immutable patterns.

return.desc:
Whether the property should be considered a change
  and enqueue a `_proeprtiesChanged` callback

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description:
Implements native Custom Elements `attributeChangedCallback` to
set an attribute value to a property via `_attributeToProperty`.

methods.name: _attributeToProperty
methods.description:
Deserializes an attribute to its associated property.

This method calls the `_deserializeValue` method to convert the string to
a typed value.

params.name: type
params.description:
type to deserialize to, defaults to the value
returned from `typeForProperty`

methods.name: _propertyToAttribute
methods.description: Serializes a property to its associated attribute.

methods.name: _valueToNodeAttribute
methods.description:
Sets a typed value to an HTML attribute on a node.

This method calls the `_serializeValue` method to convert the typed
value to a string.  If the `_serializeValue` method returns `undefined`,
the attribute will be removed (this is the default for boolean
type `false`).

methods.name: _serializeValue
methods.description:
Converts a typed JavaScript value to a string.

This method is called when setting JS property values to
HTML attributes.  Users may override this method to provide
serialization for custom types.

return.desc:
String serialized from the provided
property  value.

methods.name: _deserializeValue
methods.description:
Converts a string to a typed JavaScript value.

This method is called when reading HTML attribute values to
JS properties.  Users may override this method to provide
deserialization for custom `type`s. Types for `Boolean`, `String`,
and `Number` convert attributes to the expected types.

params.name: type
params.description: Type to deserialize the string to.

return.desc: Typed value deserialized from the provided string.

methods.name: _initializeProtoProperties
methods.description:
Overrides `Polymer.PropertyAccessors` implementation to provide a
more efficient implementation of initializing properties from
the prototype on the instance.

params.name: props
params.description: Properties to initialize on the prototype

methods.name: _ensureAttribute
methods.description:
Ensures the element has the given attribute. If it does not,
assigns the given value to the attribute.

params.name: attribute
params.description: Name of attribute to ensure is set.

methods.name: _hasAccessor
methods.description: Returns true if this library created an accessor for the given property.

return.desc: True if an accessor was created

methods.name: _isPropertyPending
methods.description: Returns true if the specified property has a pending change.

return.desc: True if property has a pending change

methods.name: _addPropertyEffect
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `addPropertyEffect` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: property
params.description: Property that should trigger the effect

methods.name: _removePropertyEffect
methods.description: Removes the given property effect.

params.name: property
params.description: Property the effect was associated with

methods.name: _hasPropertyEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a property effect
of a certain type.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasReadOnlyEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "read only"
accessor for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasNotifyEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "notify"
property effect for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasReflectEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "reflect to attribute"
property effect for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasComputedEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "computed"
property effect for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _setPendingPropertyOrPath
methods.description:
Sets a pending property or path.  If the root property of the path in
question had no accessor, the path is set, otherwise it is enqueued
via `_setPendingProperty`.

This function isolates relatively expensive functionality necessary
for the public API (`set`, `setProperties`, `notifyPath`, and property
change listeners via {{...}} bindings), such that it is only done
when paths enter the system, and not at every propagation step.  It
also sets a `__dataHasPaths` flag on the instance which is used to
fast-path slower path-matching code in the property effects host paths.

`path` can be a path string or array of path parts as accepted by the
public API.

params.name: shouldNotify
params.description:
Set to true if this change should
 cause a property notification event dispatch

params.name: isPathNotification
params.description:
If the path being set is a path
  notification of an already changed value, as opposed to a request
  to set and notify the change.  In the latter `false` case, a dirty
  check is performed and then the value is set to the path before
  enqueuing the pending property change.

return.desc:
Returns true if the property/path was enqueued in
  the pending changes bag.

methods.name: _setUnmanagedPropertyToNode
methods.description:
Applies a value to a non-Polymer element/node's property.

The implementation makes a best-effort at binding interop:
Some native element properties have side-effects when
re-setting the same value (e.g. setting `<input>.value` resets the
cursor position), so we do a dirty-check before setting the value.
However, for better interop with non-Polymer custom elements that
accept objects, we explicitly re-set object changes coming from the
Polymer world (which may include deep object changes without the
top reference changing), erring on the side of providing more
information.

Users may override this method to provide alternate approaches.

params.name: node
params.description: The node to set a property on

methods.name: _enqueueClient
methods.description:
Enqueues the given client on a list of pending clients, whose
pending property changes can later be flushed via a call to
`_flushClients`.

methods.name: _flushClients
methods.description:
Flushes any clients previously enqueued via `_enqueueClient`, causing
their `_flushProperties` method to run.

methods.name: __enableOrFlushClients
methods.description: (c) the stamped dom enables.

methods.name: _readyClients
methods.description:
Implements `PropertyEffects`'s `_readyClients` call. Attaches
element dom by calling `_attachDom` with the dom stamped from the
element's template via `_stampTemplate`. Note that this allows
client dom to be attached to the element prior to any observers
running.

methods.name: setProperties
methods.description:
Sets a bag of property changes to this instance, and
synchronously processes all effects of the properties as a batch.

Property names must be simple properties, not paths.  Batched
path propagation is not supported.

params.name: props
params.description:
Bag of one or more key-value pairs whose key is
  a property and value is the new value to set for that property.

params.name: setReadOnly
params.description:
When true, any private values set in
  `props` will be set. By default, `setProperties` will not set
  `readOnly: true` root properties.

methods.name: _propagatePropertyChanges
methods.description:
Called to propagate any property changes to stamped template nodes
managed by this element.

params.name: oldProps
params.description: Bag of previous values for changed properties

params.name: hasPaths
params.description: True with `props` contains one or more paths

methods.name: linkPaths
methods.description:
Aliases one data path as another, such that path notifications from one
are routed to the other.

methods.name: unlinkPaths
methods.description:
Removes a data path alias previously established with `_linkPaths`.

Note, the path to unlink should be the target (`to`) used when
linking the paths.

methods.name: notifySplices

params.name: splices
params.description:
Array of splice records indicating ordered
  changes that occurred to the array. Each record should have the
  following fields:
   * index: index at which the change occurred
   * removed: array of items that were removed from this index
   * addedCount: number of new items added at this index
   * object: a reference to the array in question
   * type: the string literal 'splice'

  Note that splice records _must_ be normalized such that they are
  reported in index order (raw results from `Object.observe` are not
  ordered and must be normalized/merged before notifying).

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Convenience method for reading a value from a path.

Note, if any part in the path is undefined, this method returns
`undefined` (this method does not throw when dereferencing undefined
paths).

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the value
  to read.  The path may be specified as a string (e.g. `foo.bar.baz`)
  or an array of path parts (e.g. `['foo.bar', 'baz']`).  Note that
  bracketed expressions are not supported; string-based path parts
  *must* be separated by dots.  Note that when dereferencing array
  indices, the index may be used as a dotted part directly
  (e.g. `users.12.name` or `['users', 12, 'name']`).

params.name: root
params.description: Root object from which the path is evaluated.

return.desc:
Value at the path, or `undefined` if any part of the path
  is undefined.

methods.name: set
methods.description:
Convenience method for setting a value to a path and notifying any
elements bound to the same path.

Note, if any part in the path except for the last is undefined,
this method does nothing (this method does not throw when
dereferencing undefined paths).

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the value
  to write.  The path may be specified as a string (e.g. `'foo.bar.baz'`)
  or an array of path parts (e.g. `['foo.bar', 'baz']`).  Note that
  bracketed expressions are not supported; string-based path parts
  *must* be separated by dots.  Note that when dereferencing array
  indices, the index may be used as a dotted part directly
  (e.g. `'users.12.name'` or `['users', 12, 'name']`).

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set at the specified path.

params.name: root
params.description:
Root object from which the path is evaluated.
  When specified, no notification will occur.

methods.name: push
methods.description:
Adds items onto the end of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: New length of the array.

methods.name: pop
methods.description:
Removes an item from the end of array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.pop`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: Item that was removed.

methods.name: splice
methods.description:
Starting from the start index specified, removes 0 or more items
from the array and inserts 0 or more new items in their place.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.splice`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: start
params.description: Index from which to start removing/inserting.

return.desc: Array of removed items.

methods.name: shift
methods.description:
Removes an item from the beginning of array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.pop`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: Item that was removed.

methods.name: unshift
methods.description:
Adds items onto the beginning of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: New length of the array.

methods.name: notifyPath
_createReadOnlyProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createReadOnlyProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: protectedSetter
params.description:
Creates a custom protected setter
  when `true`.

methods.name: _createPropertyObserver
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createPropertyObserver` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: method
params.description: Function or name of observer method to call

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Whether the method name should be included as
  a dependency to the effect.

methods.name: _createMethodObserver
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createMethodObserver` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Boolean or object map indicating
  whether method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

methods.name: _createNotifyingProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createNotifyingProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

methods.name: _createReflectedProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createReflectedProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

methods.name: _createComputedProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createComputedProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: property
params.description: Name of computed property to set

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Boolean or object map indicating
  whether method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

methods.name: _bindTemplate
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `bindTemplate` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

This method may be called on the prototype (for prototypical template
binding, to avoid creating accessors every instance) once per prototype,
and will be called with `runtimeBinding: true` by `_stampTemplate` to
create and link an instance of the template metadata associated with a
particular stamping.

params.name: instanceBinding
params.description:
When false (default), performs
  "prototypical" binding of the template and overwrites any previously
  bound template for the class. When true (as passed from
  `_stampTemplate`), the template info is instanced and linked into
  the list of bound templates.

return.desc:
Template metadata object; for `runtimeBinding`,
  this is an instance of the prototypical template info

methods.name: _removeBoundDom
methods.description:
Removes and unbinds the nodes previously contained in the provided
DocumentFragment returned from `_stampTemplate`.

params.name: dom
params.description:
DocumentFragment previously returned
  from `_stampTemplate` associated with the nodes to be removed

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description:
Attaches an element's stamped dom to itself. By default,
this method creates a `shadowRoot` and adds the dom to it.
However, this method may be overridden to allow an element
to put its dom in another location.

return.desc: node to which the dom has been attached.

methods.name: updateStyles
methods.description:
When using the ShadyCSS scoping and custom property shim, causes all
shimmed styles in this element (and its subtree) to be updated
based on current custom property values.

The optional parameter overrides inline custom property styles with an
object of properties where the keys are CSS properties, and the values
are strings.

Example: `this.updateStyles({'--color': 'blue'})`

These properties are retained unless a value of `null` is set.

params.name: properties
params.description:
Bag of custom property key/values to
  apply to this element.

methods.name: resolveUrl
methods.description:
Rewrites a given URL relative to a base URL. The base URL defaults to
the original location of the document containing the `dom-module` for
this element. This method will return the same URL before and after
bundling.

Note that this function performs no resolution for URLs that start
with `/` (absolute URLs) or `#` (hash identifiers).  For general purpose
URL resolution, use `window.URL`.

params.name: base
params.description:
Optional base URL to resolve against, defaults
to the element's `importPath`

return.desc: Rewritten URL relative to base

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the state of the element.

methods.name: _cleanupPopup
methods.description: Clean up popup reference and closes the window if not yet closed.

methods.name: _tokenRequestedHandler
methods.description: Handler for the `oauth2-token-requested` custom event.

methods.name: authorize
methods.description: Authorize the user using provided settings.

params.name: settings
params.description:
Map of authorization settings.
- type {String} Authorization grant type. Can be `implicit`,
`authorization_code`, `client_credentials`, `password` or custom value
as OAuth 2.0 allows extensions to grant type.

methods.name: _authorize
methods.description:
Authorizes the user in the OAuth authorization endpoint.
By default it authorizes the user using a popup that displays
authorization screen. When `interactive` property is set to `false`
on the `settings` object then it will quietly create an iframe
and try to receive the token.

methods.name: _authorizePopup
methods.description: Creates and opens auth popup.

methods.name: _authorizeTokenNonInteractive
methods.description:
Tries to Authorize the user in a non interactive way.
This method always result in a success response. When there's an error or
user is not logged in then the response won't contain auth token info.

methods.name: _cleanupFrame
methods.description: Removes the frame and any event listeners attached to it.

methods.name: _frameLoadErrorHandler
methods.description: Handler for `error` event dispatched by oauth iframe.

methods.name: _frameLoadHandler
methods.description: Handler for iframe `load` event.

methods.name: _observePopupState
methods.description: Observer if the popup has been closed befor the data has been received.

methods.name: _popupObserver
methods.description:
Function called in the interval.
Observer popup state and calls `_beforePopupUnloadHandler()`
when popup is no longer opened.

methods.name: _constructPopupUrl
methods.description: Browser or server flow: open the initial popup.

params.name: settings
params.description: Settings passed to the authorize function.

return.desc: Full URL for the endpoint.

methods.name: _computeScope
methods.description: Computes `scope` URL parameter from scopes array.

params.name: scopes
params.description: List of scopes to use with the request.

return.desc: Computed scope value.

methods.name: _popupMessageHandler
methods.description:
Listen for a message from the popup.

Token will be extracted and `oauth2-token-response` will be fired. Also, if the initial
request came from an event, a `tokenValue` property fill be set on the event target.

methods.name: randomString
methods.description: http://stackoverflow.com/a/10727155/1127848

methods.name: _beforePopupUnloadHandler
methods.description:
Popup is closed by this element so if data is not yet set it means that the
user closed the window - probably some error.
The UI state is reset if needed.

methods.name: _exchangeCode
methods.description:
Exchange code for token.
One note here. This element is intened to use with applications that test endpoints.
It asks user to provide `client_secret` parameter and it is not a security concern to him.
However, this method **can't be used in regular web applications** because it is a
security risk and whole OAuth token exchange can be compromised. Secrets should never be
present on client side.

params.name: code
params.description: Returned code from the authorization endpoint.

return.desc: Promise with token information.

methods.name: _getCodeEchangeBody
methods.description: Returns a body value for the code exchange request.

params.name: code
params.description:
Authorization code value returned by the authorization
server.

return.desc: Request body.

methods.name: _requestToken
methods.description:
Requests for token from the authorization server for `code`, `password`,
`client_credentials` and custom grant types.

params.name: url
params.description:
Base URI of the endpoint. Custom properties will be
applied to the final URL.

params.name: body
params.description:
Generated body for given type. Custom properties will
be applied to the final body.

params.name: settings
params.description: Settings object passed to the `authorize()` function

return.desc: Promise resolved to the response string.

methods.name: _processTokenResponseHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the code request load event.
Processes the response and either rejects the promise with an error
or resolves it to token info object.

methods.name: _processTokenResponseErrorHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the code request error event.
Rejects the promise with error description.

methods.name: _processCodeResponse
methods.description: Processes token request body and produces map of values.

return.desc: Response as an object.

methods.name: _handleTokenInfo
methods.description:
Processes token info object when it's ready.
Sets `tokenInfo` property, notifies listeners about the response
and cleans up.

params.name: tokenInfo
params.description: Token info returned from the server.

return.desc: The same tokenInfo, used for Promise return value.

methods.name: _handleTokenCodeError
methods.description: Handler fore an error that happened during code exchange.

methods.name: _camel
methods.description: Replaces `-` or `_` with camel case.

return.desc:
Camel cased string or `undefined` if not
transformed.

methods.name: authorizePassword
methods.description: Requests a token for `password` request type.

params.name: settings
params.description:
The same settings as passed to `authorize()`
function.

return.desc: Promise resolved to token info.

methods.name: _getPasswordBody
methods.description: Generates a payload message for password authorization.

params.name: settings
params.description:
Settings object passed to the `authorize()`
function

return.desc: Message body as defined in OAuth2 spec.

methods.name: authorizeClientCredentials
methods.description: Requests a token for `client_credentials` request type.

params.name: settings
params.description:
The same settings as passed to `authorize()`
function.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a token info object.

methods.name: _getClientCredentialsBody
methods.description: Generates a payload message for client credentials.

params.name: settings
params.description:
Settings object passed to the `authorize()`
function

return.desc: Message body as defined in OAuth2 spec.

methods.name: authorizeCustomGrant
methods.description:
Performs authorization on custom grant type.
This extension is described in OAuth 2.0 spec.

return.desc: Promise resolved to a token info object.

methods.name: _getCustomGrantBody
methods.description:
Creates a body for custom gran type.
It does not assume any parameter to be required.
It applies all known OAuth 2.0 parameters and then custom parameters

return.desc: Request body.

methods.name: _applyCustomSettingsQuery
methods.description: Applies custom properties defined in the OAuth settings object to the URL.

params.name: data
params.description:
`customData.[type]` property from the settings object.
The type is either `auth` or `token`.

methods.name: _applyCustomSettingsHeaders
methods.description: Applies custom headers from the settings object

methods.name: _applyCustomSettingsBody
methods.description: Applies custom body properties from the settings to the body value.

params.name: body
params.description:
Already computed body for OAuth request. Custom
properties are appended at the end of OAuth string.

return.desc: Request body

methods.name: _dispatchError
methods.description: Dispatches an error event that propagates through the DOM.

methods.name: _dispatchResponse
methods.description: Dispatches an error event that propagates through the DOM.

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplate

params.name: outerTemplateInfo
params.description:
Template metadata from the outer
  template, for parsing nested templates

return.desc: Parsed template metadata

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateContent
staticMethods.description:
Overrides `PropertyAccessors` to add map of dynamic functions on
template info, for consumption by `PropertyEffects` template binding
code. This map determines which method templates should have accessors
created for them.

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNode
staticMethods.description:
Overrides default `TemplateStamp` implementation to add support for
parsing bindings from `TextNode`'s' `textContent`.  A `bindings`
array is added to `nodeInfo` and populated with binding metadata
with information capturing the binding target, and a `parts` array
with one or more metadata objects capturing the source(s) of the
binding.

params.name: nodeInfo
params.description: Node metadata for current template node

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateChildNodes
staticMethods.description:
Parses template child nodes for the given root node.

This method also wraps whitelisted legacy template extensions
(`is="dom-if"` and `is="dom-repeat"`) with their equivalent element
wrappers, collapses text nodes, and strips whitespace from the template
if the `templateInfo.stripWhitespace` setting was provided.

params.name: root
params.description: Root node whose `childNodes` will be parsed

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNestedTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Overrides default `TemplateStamp` implementation to add support for
binding the properties that a nested template depends on to the template
as `_host_<property>`.

params.name: nodeInfo
params.description: Node metadata for current template node

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNodeAttributes
staticMethods.description:
Parses template node attributes and adds node metadata to `nodeInfo`
for nodes of interest.

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNodeAttribute
staticMethods.description:
Overrides default `TemplateStamp` implementation to add support for
parsing bindings from attributes.  A `bindings`
array is added to `nodeInfo` and populated with binding metadata
with information capturing the binding target, and a `parts` array
with one or more metadata objects capturing the source(s) of the
binding.

params.name: nodeInfo
params.description: Node metadata for current template node

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _contentForTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Returns the `content` document fragment for a given template.

For nested templates, Polymer performs an optimization to cache nested
template content to avoid the cost of cloning deeply nested templates.
This method retrieves the cached content for a given template.

return.desc: Content fragment

staticMethods.name: createProperties
staticMethods.description:
Override of PropertiesChanged createProperties to create accessors
and property effects for all of the properties.

staticMethods.name: attributeNameForProperty
staticMethods.description:
Returns an attribute name that corresponds to the given property.
The attribute name is the lowercased property name. Override to
customize this mapping.

return.desc: Attribute name corresponding to the given property.

staticMethods.name: typeForProperty
staticMethods.description:
Overrides `PropertiesChanged` method to return type specified in the
static `properties` object for the given property.

return.desc: Type to which to deserialize attribute

staticMethods.name: createPropertiesForAttributes
staticMethods.description:
Generates property accessors for all attributes in the standard
static `observedAttributes` array.

Attribute names are mapped to property names using the `dash-case` to
`camelCase` convention

staticMethods.name: addPropertyEffect
staticMethods.description:
Ensures an accessor exists for the specified property, and adds
to a list of "property effects" that will run when the accessor for
the specified property is set.  Effects are grouped by "type", which
roughly corresponds to a phase in effect processing.  The effect
metadata should be in the following form:

    {
      fn: effectFunction, // Reference to function to call to perform effect
      info: { ... }       // Effect metadata passed to function
      trigger: {          // Optional triggering metadata; if not provided
        name: string      // the property is treated as a wildcard
        structured: boolean
        wildcard: boolean
      }
    }

Effects are called from `_propertiesChanged` in the following order by
type:

1. COMPUTE
2. PROPAGATE
3. REFLECT
4. OBSERVE
5. NOTIFY

Effect functions are called with the following signature:

    effectFunction(inst, path, props, oldProps, info, hasPaths)

params.name: property
params.description: Property that should trigger the effect

staticMethods.name: createPropertyObserver
staticMethods.description: Creates a single-property observer for the given property.

params.name: method
params.description: Function or name of observer method to call

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Whether the method name should be included as
  a dependency to the effect.

staticMethods.name: createMethodObserver
staticMethods.description:
Creates a multi-property "method observer" based on the provided
expression, which should be a string in the form of a normal JavaScript
function signature: `'methodName(arg1, [..., argn])'`.  Each argument
should correspond to a property or path in the context of this
prototype (or instance), or may be a literal string or number.

return.desc: whether method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

staticMethods.name: createNotifyingProperty
staticMethods.description:
Causes the setter for the given property to dispatch `<property>-changed`
events to notify of changes to the property.

staticMethods.name: createReadOnlyProperty
staticMethods.description:
Creates a read-only accessor for the given property.

To set the property, use the protected `_setProperty` API.
To create a custom protected setter (e.g. `_setMyProp()` for
property `myProp`), pass `true` for `protectedSetter`.

Note, if the property will have other property effects, this method
should be called first, before adding other effects.

params.name: protectedSetter
params.description:
Creates a custom protected setter
  when `true`.

staticMethods.name: createReflectedProperty
staticMethods.description:
Causes the setter for the given property to reflect the property value
to a (dash-cased) attribute of the same name.

staticMethods.name: createComputedProperty
staticMethods.description:
Creates a computed property whose value is set to the result of the
method described by the given `expression` each time one or more
arguments to the method changes.  The expression should be a string
in the form of a normal JavaScript function signature:
`'methodName(arg1, [..., argn])'`

params.name: property
params.description: Name of computed property to set

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Boolean or object map indicating whether
  method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

staticMethods.name: bindTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Parses the provided template to ensure binding effects are created
for them, and then ensures property accessors are created for any
dependent properties in the template.  Binding effects for bound
templates are stored in a linked list on the instance so that
templates can be efficiently stamped and unstamped.

return.desc: Template metadata object

staticMethods.name: _addTemplatePropertyEffect
staticMethods.description:
Adds a property effect to the given template metadata, which is run
at the "propagate" stage of `_propertiesChanged` when the template
has been bound to the element via `_bindTemplate`.

The `effect` object should match the format in `_addPropertyEffect`.

params.name: templateInfo
params.description: Template metadata to add effect to

params.name: prop
params.description: Property that should trigger the effect

staticMethods.name: _parseBindings
staticMethods.description:
Called to parse text in a template (either attribute values or
textContent) into binding metadata.

Any overrides of this method should return an array of binding part
metadata  representing one or more bindings found in the provided text
and any "literal" text in between.  Any non-literal parts will be passed
to `_evaluateBinding` when any dependencies change.  The only required
fields of each "part" in the returned array are as follows:

- `dependencies` - Array containing trigger metadata for each property
  that should trigger the binding to update
- `literal` - String containing text if the part represents a literal;
  in this case no `dependencies` are needed

Additional metadata for use by `_evaluateBinding` may be provided in
each part object as needed.

The default implementation handles the following types of bindings
(one or more may be intermixed with literal strings):
- Property binding: `[[prop]]`
- Path binding: `[[object.prop]]`
- Negated property or path bindings: `[[!prop]]` or `[[!object.prop]]`
- Two-way property or path bindings (supports negation):
  `{{prop}}`, `{{object.prop}}`, `{{!prop}}` or `{{!object.prop}}`
- Inline computed method (supports negation):
  `[[compute(a, 'literal', b)]]`, `[[!compute(a, 'literal', b)]]`

params.name: text
params.description: Text to parse from attribute or textContent

return.desc: Array of binding part metadata

staticMethods.name: _evaluateBinding
staticMethods.description:
Called to evaluate a previously parsed binding part based on a set of
one or more changed dependencies.

params.name: inst
params.description:
Element that should be used as scope for
  binding dependencies

params.name: oldProps
params.description: Bag of previous values for changed properties

params.name: hasPaths
params.description: True with `props` contains one or more paths

return.desc: Value the binding part evaluated to

staticMethods.name: finalize
staticMethods.description:
Finalizes an element definition, including ensuring any super classes
are also finalized. This includes ensuring property
accessors exist on the element prototype. This method calls
`_finalizeClass` to finalize each constructor in the prototype chain.

staticMethods.name: _finalizeClass
staticMethods.description:
Override of PropertiesMixin _finalizeClass to create observers and
find the template.

staticMethods.name: createObservers
staticMethods.description:
Creates observers for the given `observers` array.
Leverages `PropertyEffects` to create observers.

params.name: observers
params.description:
Array of observer descriptors for
  this class

params.name: dynamicFns
params.description:
Object containing keys for any properties
  that are functions and should trigger the effect when the function
  reference is changed

staticMethods.name: _processStyleText
staticMethods.description: Gather style text for a style element in the template.

params.name: baseURI
params.description: Base URI to rebase CSS paths against

return.desc: The processed CSS text

staticMethods.name: _finalizeTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Configures an element `proto` to function with a given `template`.
The element name `is` and extends `ext` must be specified for ShadyCSS
style scoping.

params.name: is
params.description: Tag name (or type extension name) for this element

elements.name: OAuth2Authorization

attributes.name: token-info
attributes.description: A full data returned by the authorization endpoint.

elements.description:
An element to perform OAuth1 authorization and to sign auth requests.

Note that the OAuth1 authorization wasn't designed for browser. Most existing
OAuth1 implementation deisallow browsers to perform the authorization by
not allowing POST requests to authorization server. Therefore receiving token
may not be possible without using browser extensions to alter HTTP request to
enable CORS.
If the server disallow obtaining authorization token and secret from clients
then your application has to listen for `oauth1-token-requested` custom event
and perform authorization on the server side.

When auth token and secret is available and the user is to perform a HTTP request,
the request panel sends `before-request` cutom event. This element handles the event
and apllies authorization header with generated signature to the request.

## OAuth 1 configuration object

Both authorization or request signing requires detailed configuration object.
This is handled by the request panel. It sets OAuth1 configuration in the `request.auth`
property.

| Property | Type | Description |
| ----------------|-------------|---------- |
| `signatureMethod` | `String` | One of `PLAINTEXT`, `HMAC-SHA1`, `RSA-SHA1` |
| `requestTokenUrl` | `String` | Token request URI. Optional for before request. Required for authorization |
| `accessTokenUri` | `String` | Access token request URI. Optional for before request. Required for authorization |
| `authorizationUri` | `String` | User dialog URL. |
| `consumerKey` | `String` | Consumer key to be used to generate the signature. Optional for before request. |
| `consumerSecret` | `String` | Consumer secret to be used to generate the signature. Optional for before request. |
| `redirectUri` | `String` | Redirect URI for the authorization. Optional for before request. |
| `authParamsLocation` | `String` | Optional. Location of the authorization parameters. Default to `authorization` meaning it creates an authorization header. Any other value means query parameters |
| `authTokenMethod` | `String` | Token request HTTP method. Default to `POST`. Optional for before request. |
| `version` | `String` | Oauth1 protocol version. Default to `1.0` |
| `nonceSize` | `Number` | Size of the nonce word to generate. Default to 32. Unused if `nonce` is set. |
| `nonce` | `String` | Nonce to be used to generate signature. |
| `timestamp` | `Number` | Request timestamp. If not set it sets current timestamp |
| `customHeaders` | `Object` | Map of custom headers to set with authorization request |
| `type` | `String` | Must be set to `oauth1` or during before-request this object will be ignored. |
| `token` | `String` | Required for signing requests. Received OAuth token |
| `tokenSecret` | `String` | Required for signing requests. Received OAuth token secret |

## Error codes

-  `params-error` Oauth1 parameters are invalid
-  `oauth1-error` OAuth popup is blocked.
-  `token-request-error` HTTP request to the authorization server failed
-  `no-response` No response recorded.

## Acknowledgements

- This element uses [jsrsasign](https://github.com/kjur/jsrsasign) library distributed
under MIT licence.
- This element uses [crypto-js](https://code.google.com/archive/p/crypto-js/) library
distributed under BSD license.

## Changes in version 2

- replaced `redirectUrl` property with `redirectUri`
- replaced `authorizationUrl` property with `authorizationUri`
- replaced `accessTokenUrl` property with `accessTokenUri`
- **CryptoJS library is no longer included by default**. Use `advanced-rest-client/cryptojs-lib` or own veresion of the library. This component uses `CryptoJS.HmacSHA1` and `CryptoJS.enc.Base64` from the library.
- **RSAKey library is no longer included by default**. Include `https://github.com/kjur/jsrsasign` library if needed.

properties.name: tokenInfo
properties.description: A full data returned by the authorization endpoint.

properties.name: proxy
properties.description:
If set, requests made by this element to authorization endpoint will be
prefixed with the proxy value.

properties.name: lastIssuedToken
properties.description: Latest valid token exchanged with the authorization endpoint.

properties.name: consumerKey
properties.description: Oauth 1 consumer key to use with auth request

properties.name: consumerSecret
properties.description: Oauth 1 consumer secret to be used to generate the signature.

properties.name: signatureMethod
properties.description:
A signature generation method.
Once of: `PLAINTEXT`, `HMAC-SHA1` or `RSA-SHA1`

properties.name: authParamsLocation
properties.description:
Location of the OAuth authorization parameters.
It can be either `authorization` meaning as a header and
`querystring` to put OAuth parameters to the URL.

methods.name: _handleRequest
methods.description:
The `before-request` handler. Creates an authorization header if needed.
Normally `before-request` expects to set a promise on the `detail.promises`
object. But because this taks is sync it skips the promise and manipulate
request object directly.

methods.name: _applyBeforeRequestSignature
methods.description:
Applies OAuth1 authorization header with generated signature for this
request.

This method expects the `auth` object to be set on the request. The object
is full configuration for the OAuth1 authorization as described in
`auth-methods/oauth1.html` element.

methods.name: _tokenRequestedHandler
methods.description:
A handler for the `oauth1-token-requested` event.
Performs OAuth1 authorization for given settings.

The detail object of the event contains OAuth1 configuration as described
in `auth-methods/oauth1.html`element.

methods.name: authorize
methods.description: Performs a request to authorization server.

params.name: settings
params.description:
Oauth1 configuration. See description for more
details or `auth-methods/oauth1.html` element that collectes configuration
from the user.

methods.name: _prepareOauth
methods.description: Sets a configuration properties on this element from passed settings.

params.name: params
params.description:
See description for more
details or `auth-methods/oauth1.html` element that collectes configuration
from the user.

methods.name: _defaultHeaders
methods.description: List of default headers to send with auth request.

return.desc: Map of default headers.

methods.name: getTimestamp
methods.description: Returns current timestamp.

return.desc: Current timestamp

methods.name: encodeData
methods.description: URL encodes the string.

return.desc: Encoded string

methods.name: _finishEncodeParams
methods.description: Normalizes url encoded values as defined in the OAuth 1 spec.

return.desc: Normalized params.

methods.name: decodeData
methods.description:
URL decodes data.
Also replaces `+` with ` ` (space).

return.desc: Decoded string

methods.name: getSignature
methods.description: Computes signature for the request.

params.name: signatureMethod
params.description:
Method to use to generate the signature.
Supported are: `PLAINTEXT`, `HMAC-SHA1`, `RSA-SHA1`. It throws an error if
value of this property is other than listed here.

params.name: body
params.description:
Body used with the request. Note: this parameter
can only be set if the request's content-type header equals
`application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.

return.desc: Generated OAuth1 signature for given `signatureMethod`

methods.name: _normalizeUrl
methods.description:
Normalizes URL to base string URI as described in
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.4.1.2

return.desc: Base String URI
True if the `parameter` is an OAuth 1 parameter.

methods.name: _buildAuthorizationHeaders
methods.description:
Creates an Authorization header value to trasmit OAuth params in headers
as described in https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.5.1

params.name: orderedParameters
params.description:
Oauth parameters that are already
ordered.

return.desc: The Authorization header value

methods.name: _buildFormDataParameters
methods.description:
Creates a body for www-urlencoded content type to transmit OAuth params
in request body as described in
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.5.2

params.name: orderedParameters
params.description:
Oauth parameters that are already
ordered.

return.desc: The body to send

methods.name: _buildAuthorizationQueryStirng
methods.description:
Adds query paramteres with OAuth 1 parameters to the URL
as described in https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.5.3

params.name: orderedParameters
params.description:
Oauth parameters that are already
ordered.

return.desc: URL to use with the request

methods.name: _makeArrayOfArgumentsHash
methods.description: of argument/value pairs.

methods.name: _sortRequestParams
methods.description: Sorts the encoded key value pairs by encoded name, then encoded value

methods.name: _sortParamsFunction
methods.description:
Sort function to sort parameters as described in
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.4.1.3.2

methods.name: _normaliseRequestParams
methods.description:
Normalizes request parameters as described in
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.4.1.3.2

params.name: args
params.description:
List of parameters to normalize. It must contain
a list of array items where first element of the array is parameter name
and second is parameter value.

return.desc: Normalized parameters to string.

methods.name: _listQueryParameters
methods.description: Computes array of parameters from the request URL.

return.desc:
Array of parameters where each item is an array with
first element as a name of the parameter and second element as a value.

methods.name: _formUrlEncodedToParams
methods.description:
Computes array of parameters from the entity body.
The body must be `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.

return.desc:
Array of parameters where each item is an array with
first element as a name of the parameter and second element as a value.
Keys and values are percent decoded. Additionally each `+` is replaced
with space character.

methods.name: createSignatureBase
methods.description:
Creates a signature base as defined in
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.4.1

params.name: method
params.description: HTTP method used with the request

params.name: oauthParams
params.description: Key - value pairs of OAuth parameters

params.name: body
params.description:
Body used with the request. Note: this parameter
can only be set if the request's content-type header equals
`application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.

return.desc: A base string to be used to generate signature.

methods.name: createSignatureKey
methods.description:
Creates a signature key to compute the signature as described in
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849#section-3.4.2

return.desc: A key to be used to generate the signature.

methods.name: hex2b64
methods.description: Found at http://jsfiddle.net/ARTsinn/6XaUL/

return.desc: Result of transforming value to string.

methods.name: _createSignaturePlainText
methods.description:
Creates a signature for the PLAINTEXT method.

In this case the signature is the key.

return.desc: Computed OAuth1 signature.

methods.name: _createSignatureRsaSha1
methods.description: Creates a signature for the RSA-SHA1 method.

return.desc: Computed OAuth1 signature.

methods.name: _createSignatureHamacSha1
methods.description: Creates a signature for the HMAC-SHA1 method.

return.desc: Computed OAuth1 signature.

methods.name: encodeUriParams
methods.description: Encodes parameters in the map.

methods.name: signRequestObject
methods.description:
Creates OAuth1 signature for a `request` object.
The request object must contain:
- `url` - String
- `method` - String
- `headers` - String
It also may contain the `body` property.

It alters the request object by applying OAuth1 parameters to a set
location (qurey parameters, authorization header, body). This is
controlled by `this.authParamsLocation` property. By default the
parameters are applied to authorization header.

params.name: token
params.description:
OAuth token to use to generate the signature.
If not set, then it will use a value from `this.lastIssuedToken`.

params.name: tokenSecret
params.description:
OAuth token secret to use to generate the
signature. If not set, then it will use a value from
`this.lastIssuedToken`.

return.desc: The same object with applied OAuth 1 parameters.

methods.name: getOAuthAccessToken
methods.description:
Exchanges temporary authorization token for authorized token.
When ready this function fires `oauth1-token-response`

methods.name: clearRequestVariables
methods.description:
Clears variables set for current request after signature has been
generated and token obtained.

methods.name: getOAuthRequestToken
methods.description:
Requests the authorization server for temporarty authorization token.
This token should be passed to `authorizationUri` as a `oauth_token`
parameter.

params.name: extraParams
params.description:
List of extra parameters to include in the
request.

return.desc:
A promise resolved to a map of OAuth 1 parameters:
`oauth_token`, `oauth_token_secret`, `oauth_verifier` and
`oauth_callback_confirmed` (for 1.0a version).

methods.name: request
methods.description:
Makes a HTTP request.
Before making the request it sends `auth-request-proxy` custom event
with the URL and init object in event's detail object.
If the event is cancelled then it will use detail's `result` value to
return from this function. The `result` must be a Promise that will
resolve to a `Response` object.
Otherwise it will use internall `fetch` implementation.

params.name: init
params.description:
Init object that will be passed to a `Request`
object.

return.desc: A promise that resolves to a `Response` object.

methods.name: _fetch
methods.description:
Performs a HTTP request.
If `proxy` is set or `iron-meta` with a key `auth-proxy` is set then
it will prefix the URL with the value of proxy.

params.name: init
params.description:
Init object that will be passed to a `Request`
object.

return.desc: A promise that resolves to a `Response` object.

methods.name: _observePopupState
methods.description: Observer if the popup has been closed befor the data has been received.

methods.name: _dispatchError
methods.description: Dispatches an error event that propagates through the DOM.

methods.name: parseMapKeys
methods.description:
Adds camel case keys to a map of parameters.
It adds new keys to the object tranformed from `oauth_token`
to `oauthToken`

methods.name: _parseParameter
methods.description:
Parses a query parameter object to produce camel case map of parameters.
This sets values to the `settings` object which is passed by reference.
No need to return value.

elements.name: OAuth1Authorization

attributes.name: token-info
attributes.description: A full data returned by the authorization endpoint.

attributes.name: proxy
attributes.description:
If set, requests made by this element to authorization endpoint will be
prefixed with the proxy value.

attributes.name: last-issued-token
attributes.description: Latest valid token exchanged with the authorization endpoint.

attributes.name: consumer-key
attributes.description: Oauth 1 consumer key to use with auth request

attributes.name: consumer-secret
attributes.description: Oauth 1 consumer secret to be used to generate the signature.

attributes.name: signature-method
attributes.description:
A signature generation method.
Once of: `PLAINTEXT`, `HMAC-SHA1` or `RSA-SHA1`

attributes.name: auth-params-location
attributes.description:
Location of the OAuth authorization parameters.
It can be either `authorization` meaning as a header and
`querystring` to put OAuth parameters to the URL.
